Posts.Content: Bestbird's MBC guide is just recently available on Amazon. The kindle version is only $4.99 and the paperback is $14. Well worth the investment, it is awesome. It is called the Insiders Guide to Metastatic Breast Cancer by Anne Loeser. Here is the link: https://www.amazon.com/Insiders-Guide-Metastatic-Breast-Cancer/d... Best wishes and hugs to you and your wife. Carrie
Posts.Title: Electrochemotherapy

Posts.Content: Sounds very good. My surgeon said that a Ki67 below 19% means that the cancer is growing so slow that it may not respond to chemo so I was put on just hormonal therapy, (Lupron to shut down ovaries and Arimidex as my aromatase inhibitor). Ki67 basically measures how many of the cancer cells were dividing at the time the tumor was removed. My Ki67 was 20% so I was on the fence and I had some of the tumor sent to OncoType and I got a score of 0 so I then was sure I didn't want to do chemo. Hugs, Carrie
Posts.Title: Pathology result after mastectomy

Posts.Content: You need a breast MRI!! Lobular breast cancer often does not show up on mammograms. It shows up on MRIs. About 90% of breast cancers start in the milk ducts and are called ductal carcinoma. Lobular is less common and tends to be missed since it is harder to diagnose. At the very least get a 3D ultrasound of the breast. It can be seen on ultrasound quite often and maybe a quick and cheaper way to proceed. And good for you for advocating for yourself and reaching out. Let us know if you need more advice. We are happy to share. Hugs to you. Carrie
Posts.Title: Numb chin

Posts.Content: Hi Zoe, one thing to remember about spine mets is that bone takes longer to regenerate so you can’t see major differences on scans until some time has passed. It takes 6 to 9 months to really see the healing of the bones. Give it more time. Best to you. Carrie
Posts.Title: I am on Ibrance and Letrozole and wondered if the treatment can reduce my b

Posts.Content: Dear Yechi, Did you get a biopsy of the new progression? I think I would want to know what has changed. Getting the genetics done on it could be helpful too. I agree with Beatez, it is just a setback and at least it isn't in a bad place. But of course, I understand your anxiety. I struggle with keeping positive. Sending you a virtual hug. Carrie
